entries.title: Macron Seeks Bigger Military, Leaner Pension System
entries.description: The French president’s pledge to boost military spending, a day after a million people protested his planned pension overhaul, illustrates the test facing European welfare systems as the costs of war in Ukraine pile up.

entries.title: China's Global Mega-Projects Are Falling Apart
entries.description: Many of China’s Belt and Road infrastructure projects are plagued with construction flaws, including a giant hydropower plant in Ecuador, adding more costs to a program criticized for leading countries deeper into debt; “They’re falling apart bit by bit.”

entries.title: China Visa Offices Overwhelmed in Wake of Border Opening
entries.description: Long wait times sow anxiety among overseas Chinese trying to visit relatives sick with Covid.

entries.title: U.S., Allies Step Up Ukraine Military Aid as German Hesitancy Over Tanks Threatens Rift
entries.description: Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin and allies gathered to discuss a significant boost in military aid for Ukraine as the question of whether Germany will greenlight tanks for Kyiv threatened to expose a fracture among Ukraine’s supporters.

entries.title: China Confronts First Lunar New Year Since Covid Lockdowns Ended
entries.description: Chinese authorities delivered mixed messages ahead of the first Lunar New Year holiday since the country emerged from its yearslong zero-Covid slumber.

entries.title: Yellen Pledges to Deepen Africa Ties as U.S. Wards Off Russian, Chinese Influence
entries.description: The Treasury secretary pledged further U.S. investment in and trade with Africa as she began a three-country tour of the continent.

entries.title: Mask-Wearing Champions Japan and South Korea Look to End the Habit
entries.description: “We want to restore normalcy,” says Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida, but many in the country prefer to keep their faces covered.

entries.title: How New Zealand's Jacinda Ardern Went from Pandemic Hero to Political Casualty
entries.description: Prime minister’s resignation shows how incumbents who were widely praised for their early pandemic response are finding it difficult to pivot to meet the challenges of the post-Covid world.

entries.title: Peru Protesters March in Capital Against Government
entries.description: Thousands from the Andean highlands urged President Dina Boluarte to resign after weeks of deadly clashes.

entries.title: Mexican Officials and Witnesses Recount Gunbattle That Captured Son of Joaquín 'El Chapo' Guzmán
entries.description: The arrest of Sinaloa cartel leader Ovidio Guzmán, a pioneer in producing and smuggling fentanyl, deals a blow to the Sinaloa cartel, but labs quickly reopen.
